It's a bit short, but it's a must play for every HL2-fans out there. The story is set right after the ending of HL2, and it gives you a good picture of the aftermath. I like that the gravity gun is more important this time around. It's been used more to solve puzzles and fighting enemies than before. Gameplaywise it's more the same as HL2, which is a good thing.

The ending is a bit harsh, and it's way too short, but it's still on the quality of Half-Life 2. A must-buy for anyone wanting to continue the story-line, and not one you can skip, like Blue Shift or Opposing Force.
Kinda short, little annoying. Good gameplay except for the dogshit bit at the end with the train.

It's more Half-Life 2. It's not very complicated.

Seriously that's pretty much it, I don't really know what else to say. Quality doesn't dip a bit. Looks a bit better than the base game. Of both the episodes and the original game, I would probably say this is my least favorite, but that hardly means a thing. It's still on par with the rest. Really short, but that's just because of the episodic format. Alyx has much more of a presence in this game, and is your follower for just about the entire duration.

I really don't have anything else to say. If you liked Half-Life 2, I'm honestly not sure why you're not already playing this.

4/5

Short but fun and it is HalfLife, so do not need to say more.

This game is a ton of fun. It's a departure from previous half-life games in that instead of going through a full story and trying to reinvent the same formula and set of mechanics, it tries several interesting concepts that wouldn't work on a larger scale, making for a game that's short but super original.
Not as good as the base game or episode 2, but still fun and worth a play. Plus, episode 2 is based on it so for story so just play it.
A fun expansion to Half-Life 2. I enjoy being accompanied by Alyx, especially attempting to do the One Free Bullet achievement. Fun story, and a worthy expansion.
